intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. adenobupleuroides, commonly known as the adenobupleuroides hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lanceolate, with a hairy surface, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a composite head. It is noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in anthropogenic environments.
